intro: Brachyrhynchos cymbalariifolius var. flavus, commonly known as the yellow-flowered cymbalariifolius, is a flowering plant characterized by its distinctive yellow blooms. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is native to tropical regions of South America. The plant features lanceolate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a velvety texture. Its flowers are typically clustered in whorls, with tubular corollas that open into five lobes. This variant is prized for its ornamental value in gardens and its ability to thrive in partial shade.
